direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve checking the presence of a key in the map.
Both methods involve checking the presence of an element in the map, but for different types (key vs. value).
Both methods involve key-value operations and handle similar exception scenarios.
Both methods handle unsupported operations similarly.
The getEntry method can be used to retrieve the entry associated with a key, similar to the get method.

enhanced_by.reason: Initializing the map state is a prerequisite for any key-value operation.
Putting a key-value pair into the map is a prerequisite for getting a value by key.
Verifying if the key exists can help in constructing assertions for the get method.
